item.title: 欧盟最环保基金迎来牛市中最大一次资金外流
item.description: 晨星公司（Morningstar Inc）的最新报告显示，由于投资者为了寻求更好的回报而放弃了这一策略，符合欧盟最严格的环境、社会和公司治理标准的基金在上个季度遭遇了创纪录的资金外流。【原文：Funds complying with the European Union’s strictest ESG standards suffered record outflows last quarter, as investors turned away from the strategy in search of better returns, according to a fresh report by Morningstar Inc.】

item.title: 英国公司将建造新西兰最大的太阳能发电站
item.description: 英国开发商 Harmony Energy Ltd. 在完成项目融资后，将开始建设新西兰最大的太阳能发电场。【原文：UK developer Harmony Energy Ltd. will start building New Zealand’s largest solar farm after closing financing for the project.】

item.title: 我不羡慕英国气候变化主管的工作
item.description:
人们希望感受到绿色转型不是发生在他们身上，而是与他们共同完成的。【原文：

People want to feel like the green transition isn’t happening to them, but with them. I asked how Emma Pinchbeck intends to deliver. 

】

item.title: 民意调查显示，瑞士将在投票中否决严格的排放限制措施
item.description: 瑞士选民将否决绿党青年团提出的一套严格的气候规则，因为大多数人认为经济成本过高。【原文：Swiss voters are set to reject a set of strict climate rules proposed by the youth wing of the Green party, as a majority of the population deems economic costs too great.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结拜登的绿色银行、电动汽车税收抵免等项目
item.description: 特朗普政府下令在政府范围内冻结开支，其中包括针对清洁能源项目的 4000 亿美元绿色银行和广受欢迎的电动汽车消费税减免。【原文：A $400 billion green bank for clean energy projects and a popular consumer tax credit for electric vehicles are among items being targeted for review under a government-wide spending freeze ordered by the Trump administration.】

item.title: 科学家称，气候变化使洛杉矶的火灾风险增加了 35
item.description:
世界天气归因研究小组的分析发现，全球变暖加剧了洛杉矶地区的火灾状况。【原文：

Global warming exacerbated fire conditions in the Los Angeles area, an analysis by the research group World Weather Attribution finds. 

】

item.title: 法国法院裁定素食食品可使用肉类标签
item.description: 在法国最高行政法院驳回了政府禁止植物性食品使用肉类标签的企图之后，企业可以继续在法国销售 "素食牛排 "和 "素食香肠"。【原文：Companies can continue to sell “vegetarian steaks” and “vegan sausages” in France after the country’s top administrative court overruled government attempts to ban the use of meat labels for plant-based foods.】

item.title: 德国监管机构提出废除银行厌恶的绿色指标
item.description: 德国最高金融监管机构表示，将支持废除一项衡量银行向可再生能源和可持续发展企业贷款的指标，该指标被业界讥讽为不全面且具有误导性。【原文：Germany’s top financial regulator signaled that it would support the abolition of a metric for measuring banks’ lending to renewable energy and sustainable companies that the industry has derided as incomplete and misleading.】

item.title: DeepSeek 破解人工智能与排放方程式
item.description: DeepSeek 的狂热已经席卷全球。今天的时事通讯将探讨这对排放、公用事业和电网意味着什么。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。此外，我们还将介绍一家希望通过超导液氮冷电缆传输能源的初创公司。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：DeepSeek mania has taken the world by storm. Today’s newsletter looks at what it means for emissions, utilities and the grid. You can read and share a full version of this story on Bloomberg.com. Plus, a look at a startup that wants to transmit energy via superconducting, liquid nitrogen-chilled cables. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 科学家争分夺秒测量洛杉矶大火对海洋生物的影响
item.description:
野火爆发时，研究人员正在洛杉矶海岸进行考察，这为实时测量有毒物质对食物网的影响提供了难得的机会。【原文：

Researchers were on an expedition off the LA coast when the wildfires erupted, providing a rare chance to measure toxic effects on the food web in real time.

】

item.title: 阿联酋正在测试云层播种增雨技术
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国正在测试旨在通过云播种提高降雨量的技术，因为这个沙漠国家正在努力提高水资源的安全性。【原文：The United Arab Emirates is testing technologies aimed at boosting the rain generated by cloud seeding, as the desert nation bids to improve water security.】

item.title: 人工智能的电力需求意味着无聊电网将迎来酷炫的新技术
item.description:
为数据中心供电的热潮正在帮助开发超导电缆和实时电网信息的初创企业寻找新的投资者。【原文：

The rush to power data centers is helping startups developing superconducting cables and real-time grid information find new investors.

】

item.title: DeepSeek 的人工智能模型颠覆了白热化的美国电力市场
item.description:
中国公司正在迅速改变对单个机型电力需求的假设，但人工智能领域的排放问题仍令人担忧。【原文：

The Chinese company is rapidly changing assumptions about individual models’ power needs, but the AI sector’s emissions are still a concern.

】

item.title: 赫尔米尼亚风暴引发法国洪灾，阿尔卑斯山雪崩风险加剧
item.description: 赫尔米尼亚风暴加剧了法国西北部的洪灾，并在阿尔卑斯山造成了危险的雪崩状况。【原文：Storm Herminia fueled more flooding in northwest France and created dangerous avalanche conditions in the Alps.】

item.title: BaFin 在评估气候影响时更加关注物理风险
item.description: 德国监管机构 BaFin 表示，由于洪水和干旱等事件的影响日益严重，德国金融业需要更好地把握气候变化带来的实际风险。【原文：German watchdog BaFin said the country’s financial industry needs a better grasp of physical risks stemming from climate change because of the increasing impact of events such as floods and droughts.】

item.title: 随着地球捕获更多能量，海洋变暖的速度越来越快
item.description:
最新研究结果提供了早期证据，证明燃烧化石燃料是导致 2023 年和 2024 年海洋温度飙升的主要原因。【原文：

New findings provide early evidence that burning fossil fuels played a major role in the worrying spike in ocean temperatures in 2023 and 2024.

】

item.title: 邦迪海滩议员称气候行动不能等待经济好转
item.description: 澳大利亚独立议员阿莱格拉-斯彭德（Allegra Spender）坚持认为，气候行动不能被国家的经济困难所耽搁，并提出了她在下届大选后组成少数党政府时可能会提出的要求。【原文：Australian independent lawmaker Allegra Spender has insisted that climate action can’t be delayed by the nation’s economic difficulties, setting up her potential demands in the event of a minority government following the next election.】

item.title: 特朗普下令联邦政府控制加州水资源
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统主张联邦政府对加利福尼亚州的水资源管理决策拥有更多控制权，并命令美国官员凌驾于地方当局之上，认为这些措施是提高该州灭火能力所必需的。【原文：President Donald Trump is asserting more federal government control over water management decisions in California and ordering US officials to override local authorities, casting the steps as necessary to boost the state’s firefighting capabilities.】

item.title: 波士顿和新英格兰地区近海发生小地震
item.description: 周一上午，缅因州海岸附近发生了一次小地震，震中位于新英格兰北部，包括波士顿地区的一些地方。【原文：Northern New England, including some parts of the Boston area, was shaken by a small earthquake that rumbled just off the coast of Maine on Monday morning.】

item.title: 研究显示：气候变化将导致欧洲死亡人数增加
item.description:
最新研究表明，未来几年死于过热的人数将超过死于极寒天气的人数降幅。【原文：

New research shows more people will die from overheating in the coming years than the fall in deaths from extremely cold weather.

】

item.title: 加州暴风雨引发泥石流风险，州际公路关闭
item.description: 随着阵雨继续浸润洛杉矶周围被烧焦的土地，南加州将再多几个紧张的小时。【原文：Southern California will clock a few more tense hours as showers continue to soak the burn-scarred landscape around Los Angeles.】

item.title: 联邦紧急事务管理局的未来
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将探讨联邦紧急事务管理局（FEMA）面临的威胁。唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统已经召集了一个委员会来审查该机构的效用，有可能在洛杉矶最需要它的时候取消或彻底改革它。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享完整报道。如需了解更多气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the what’s at stake with FEMA under threat. President Donald Trump has convened a council to examine the usefulness of the agency, potentially eliminating or overhauling it just when Los Angeles needs it most. You can read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 纽约最大太阳能发电场获 9.5 亿美元融资
item.description:
位于水牛城东部基尼西县的 500 兆瓦 Cider 项目预计将于 2026 年竣工。【原文：

The 500-megawatt Cider project in Genesee County east of Buffalo is expected to be completed in 2026.

】

item.title: 德国担心电池热潮将加剧电网拥堵
item.description: 德国将大型电池的推广作为清洁能源网络顺利运行的关键。然而，政府官员和输电运营商担心，如果管理不当，在错误的地点建造这些电池将会堵塞电网。【原文：Germany has touted the rollout of large batteries as key to the smooth running of a clean-energy grid. Yet there’s fear among government officials and transmission operators that building these in the wrong location will clog up the network if not properly managed.】

item.title: 花旗分析师称特朗普政策无法逆转能源转型
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：The policies of President Donald Trump will fail to hold back progress in transitioning away from high-carbon energy sources, according to analysts at Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 暴风雨触发西欧红色天气警报
item.description: 风暴 "赫米妮亚 "引发了葡萄牙北部和西班牙沿岸巨浪的红色警报，而法国的伊勒维兰省（Ile-et-Vilaine）则在为洪水做准备。【原文：Storm Herminia triggered red alerts for huge waves along the coast of northern Portugal and Spain, while the French department of Ile-et-Vilaine braced for flooding.】

item.title: 中国可再生能源学会称，2024 年中国能源高速增长导致排放量上升
item.description: 根据能源与清洁空气研究中心（Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air）的数据，去年中国的碳排放量略有增长，原因是新安装的清洁电力设备跟不上能源需求的激增。【原文：China’s carbon emissions grew slightly last year as new clean power installations couldn’t keep pace with a surge in energy demand, according to the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air.】

item.title: 特朗普在争夺更多化石燃料的战斗中夺取战时权力
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布进入能源紧急状态，这为他行使冷战时期的广泛权力和鲜为人知的权威打开了大门，以便快速铺设输油管道、扩大电网和挽救陷入困境的煤电厂。【原文：President Donald Trump’s declaration of an energy emergency opens the door to wield sweeping Cold War-era powers and little-known authorities to fast track pipelines, expand power grids and save struggling coal plants.】

item.title: 洛杉矶 "雨水充沛"，但仍面临山体滑坡风险
item.description: 南加州终于迎来了一些急需的降雨，这将为仍在与多处大火搏斗的消防员提供帮助，不过潮湿的天气也带来了山体滑坡的风险。【原文：Southern California is finally getting some much-needed rain that will assist firefighters still battling several blazes, though wet weather also brings the risk of landslides.】

item.title: 狂风暴雨袭击英国和法国，爱尔兰数千人断电
item.description: 伦敦（美联社）— 在这场多年来破坏性最大的暴风雨过后，爱尔兰向英国和法国求援，抢修人员努力恢复数十万人的供电。就在清理工作继续进行的同时，英国、爱尔兰和法国在周日遭遇了更多潮湿多风的天气。【原文：LONDON (AP) — Ireland called in help from England and France as repair crews worked to restore power to hundreds of thousands of people after the most disruptive storm for years. Even as the cleanup continued, more wet and windy weather hit the U.K., Ireland and France on Sunday.】
